content:
Launch a Flyout from an Action on a FlexCard

Create a flyout to display additional information when a user clicks an action on a FlexCard. For example, a FlexCard that displays Account information can display the Primary Contact's name and email address in a flyout.

When embedding a component, confirm that it isn’t called multiple times. See Fix Cyclic Redundancy When Embedding FlexCard Components.

Drag an Action element into a state.
Select Flyout from the Action Type dropdown.
From the Flyout Type dropdown, select Child Card, Custom LWC, or OmniScripts as the type of component to display inside the flyout.
Click into the Flyout field and select a component to display in your flyout.

(Optional) To use the data source from the parent FlexCard, click into Data Node and select what data to send to the child.

The component must be active to select it from the list of available components.

(Optional) To set attributes available from the flyout's component to use on the child component, click + Add New next to Attributes.
Enter the name of an attribute in the Key field.
Click into the Value field, and select a merge field or enter plain text.
To access the attribute in the child component, use the {Parent} context variable.

(Optional) Select whether to display the flyout as a window or popover from the Open Flyout In dropdown.

(Optional) Beginning with Summer '21, to reset the component to its load state when the flyout closes, select Reset Component On Close.
(Optional) Beginning with Summer '21, enable the component to load before it's clicked by checking Preload Flyout Component.

What’s next: To style your action element, click Style to open the Style panel.
title: Launch a Flyout from an Action on a FlexCard
